content: General Career Asked by AnonymousAsked on 15 Sep 2018How to be an entrepreneur in Singapore with no money?Hi, I have a business idea but I have no connection to the right people and money. I am confident to give it a shot. I believe that my Poly diploma and business idea is enough to sustain me. I want to execute this idea after my NS but I have no idea how to start. Please advice.9 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (9)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

HC Tang, Financial Enthusiast, Budgeting at The SocietyLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 16 Sep 2018hiNo worries. In SG, we have the best community and support by government for startup. ​No $, no problem. Suggest after NS, work and save some $ too because it's always needed to put in some own $. ​Few pathway i would suggest:Go back to your poly, find out from the info side any incubator for startup, they will link you up to mentor, angel investor (or sometimes is even your poly itself) and the people who are also interested to start a biz.Most important steps: Networking. You need to network to: (a) Find co-founders (because if you're biz but not tech, it won't work. If you're tech but you also can't cope with just biz because you'll have no time to do all well. So you need co-founder. (b) Test your ideas and learn how to pitch: Network allows you to learn how to talk / pitch to strangers, the most basic and important steps of any startup founders. It also allows you to talk to stranger about your ideas, bounds idea around as they might brinig a different perspective to you so that you can further develop and further mature your ideas. Otherwise it will just stay in your brain as an imaginary ideas. Don't worry about people stealling your ideas, its' all about the executions. They can steal but may not have the persistency to continue and bring the idea to real fruitations.(C) Find fundings / investor:  Network allows you find the right support that will leads you to the suitable Angel investor for a start and subsequenty also the mentorship on running the startup since nobody was born to know how to run a startup but also same as everyone else, learn on the job. You can join : http://www.ntuc.org.sg/ustartup/ They provides linking to the right people, networking  and  you can expand from there and find out more. ​Young NTUC also may have some good opportunities of similar mindset looking to start a biz /ideas: ​https://www.youngntuc.org.sg/wps/portal/ydu2/home/aboutus/!ut/p/a1/04_Sj9CPykssy0xPLMnMz0vMAfGjzOK9LFzdPZyDDbwsHAMMDBy9g93MvS2cjB1djYEKIoEKDHAARwNC-sP1o8BK8JhQkBthkO6oqAgA0ZoLrw!!/dl5/d5/L2dJQSEvUUt3QS80SmlFL1o2X1BMT0lFRkgyMDhURUEwSUxGMDRFMTNQRDI2/​Happy Starting up! ​0 comments0
Nicholas ChanLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 16 Sep 2018Spring Singapore has alot of funding programmes for startups, I heard they are quite easy to get, check them out!0 comments0
Good Day Every DayLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 16 Sep 2018Find a mentor who knows the way and is willing to guide you. That will save you a lot of headaches and heartaches. 0 comments0

Nicholes Wong, Diploma in Business Management at Nanyang PolytechnicLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 16 Sep 2018No money then find part time and save up. Im planning to save $15,000 for NSYou can check the linkhttps://blog.seedly.sg/national-service-ns-how-much-can-one-save/Even if i dun get into ocs or scs, i will try to do guard duty around once a month for $100 each time which can earn me $2400. Then also be frugal with my spending during ns since food is paid, transport not going to be often. Going out during book out wont be very often as well because NS also tiring. If you aim for officer and do guard duty every week, you can reduce your spending and save a lot. Or you can even do part time tutoring but do remember you are not supposed to work during 2 years in NS so dont get caught.0 comments0
Jay LiuLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 16 Sep 2018Since you said you want to execute this idea after idea, save up a lot during ns. Heck it and work to gain extra income. 0 comments0

Gabriel LeeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 16 Sep 2018Hey, I used to study in Ngee Ann Polytechnic and I understand that the Sandbox has a Startup Incubator programme for potential entrepreneurs / students with business ideas. You need to pitch your idea and if it's viable, they provide you with funding and space to execute your idea. I'm not sure if it's open to all but you can check it out and contact them to enquire more! https://www.np.edu.sg/thesandbox/Pages/incubator.aspxBut generally, you'll need backing from investors to fund the execution of your idea0 comments0
Jeff Yeo,   amateur Social contributor  at School of social sharingLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 16 Sep 2018Find a VC to fund your ideaJoin a support communityfriends and family for help0 comments0

Jonathan Chia Guangrong, Fund Manager at JCG FundLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 16 Sep 2018Find someone, a mentor, who has been running his/her own business for a period of time and run through your idea. Someone you really can trust. Buy lunch for him/her and show them your idea and ask for opinion on your plan first and of there are any areas that may be improved on. Or if they are unsure cos it's not their area of expertise, see if they know someone that does. Hope this helps, and all the best 0 comments0
Gabriel Tham, Tag Team Member at Kenichi Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 16 Sep 2018Maybe you can try looking to raise funds from family, relatives and friends​​0 comments0
